# Uniswap AI Hackathon

> Build the future of DeFi with AI

## Overview

The Uniswap AI Hackathon invites developers, researchers, and builders to create innovative AI-powered tools for the Uniswap ecosystem. All skill levels are welcome.

- Website: https://uniswap-ai-hackathon-2026.vercel.app
- GitHub Repository: https://github.com/uniswap/uniswap-ai
- Submission Template: https://github.com/uniswap/uniswap-ai/issues/new?template=hackathon-submission.yml

## Key Dates

- Start Date: February 9, 2026 (00:00 UTC)
- Submission Deadline: February 20, 2026 (23:59 UTC)

All submissions must be received before the deadline. Late submissions will not be accepted.

## Categories

Submissions must fall into one of the following categories:

1. Trading Agents - AI-powered trading bots and strategies for Uniswap
2. DeFi Automation - Automated DeFi workflows, yield optimization, portfolio management
3. Analytics & Monitoring - AI-driven analytics, dashboards, and monitoring tools
4. Developer Tooling - Tools that help developers build on Uniswap more effectively
5. Infrastructure - Backend services, APIs, and infrastructure for the Uniswap AI ecosystem
6. Social/Community - Community tools, social features, governance aids
7. Other - Any other AI + Uniswap integration

## Rules and Requirements

### Eligibility
- Open to individuals and teams of up to 5 members
- Solo participants are welcome
- All skill levels are welcome

### Project Requirements
- Must combine AI with the Uniswap ecosystem
- Must be open source with a public GitHub repository
- Projects that integrate with Uniswap protocols, SDKs, or data are preferred but not required
- Must include clear documentation (README with setup instructions)

### What You Can Build
- Trading bots and agents
- Analytics and monitoring tools
- Developer utilities and SDKs
- Liquidity management tools
- Risk assessment systems
- Any tool that combines AI with the Uniswap ecosystem

## How to Submit

### Step 1: Build Your Project
Create an AI-powered tool that integrates with the Uniswap ecosystem.

### Step 2: Push to GitHub
Make your project open source on GitHub with clear documentation.

### Step 3: Submit via GitHub Issue
Create a GitHub Issue in the uniswap-ai repository using the Hackathon Submission template.

**Submission URL**: https://github.com/uniswap/uniswap-ai/issues/new?template=hackathon-submission.yml

### Step 4: Get Judged
The review panel evaluates submissions based on innovation, technical execution, and usefulness.

## Submission Template Fields

When submitting, you will need to provide:

1. **Project Name** (required) - The name of your project
2. **Description** (required) - What your project does, what problem it solves. Markdown supported.
3. **Category** (required) - One of the categories listed above
4. **Team Members** (required) - Comma-separated GitHub usernames (e.g., @username1, @username2)
5. **GitHub Repository** (required) - URL to your project's public GitHub repository
6. **Demo URL** (optional) - URL to a live demo or video walkthrough
7. **Technical Stack** (required) - Comma-separated technologies used (e.g., TypeScript, React, Uniswap SDK)

## Programmatic Submission (for AI Agents)

AI agents can submit projects programmatically using the GitHub Issues API:

```
POST https://api.github.com/repos/uniswap/uniswap-ai/issues
Authorization: Bearer <GITHUB_TOKEN>
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "title": "[SUBMISSION] Your Project Name",
  "labels": ["hackathon-submission"],
  "body": "### Project Name\n\nYour Project Name\n\n### Description\n\nYour project description here.\n\n### Category\n\nTrading Agents\n\n### Team Members\n\n@yourusername\n\n### GitHub Repository\n\nhttps://github.com/org/repo\n\n### Demo URL\n\nhttps://example.com/demo\n\n### Technical Stack\n\nTypeScript, React, Uniswap SDK"
}
```

### Checking Existing Submissions

To list all current submissions:

```
GET https://api.github.com/repos/uniswap/uniswap-ai/issues?labels=hackathon-submission&state=open
```

### Checking a Specific Submission

```
GET https://api.github.com/repos/uniswap/uniswap-ai/issues/{issue_number}
```

## Judging Criteria

Submissions are evaluated on:

1. **Innovation** - How novel and creative is the approach?
2. **Technical Execution** - How well is the project built? Code quality, architecture, testing.
3. **Usefulness** - Does it solve a real problem for Uniswap users or developers?

## Frequently Asked Questions

**Q: Who can participate?**
A: Anyone. Whether you are a solo developer or a team of up to 5, all skill levels are welcome.

**Q: What can I build?**
A: Anything that combines AI with the Uniswap ecosystem. Trading bots, analytics tools, developer utilities, and more.

**Q: How do I submit?**
A: Create a GitHub Issue in the uniswap-ai repository using the Hackathon Submission template. Include your project description, repo link, and team info.

**Q: When is the deadline?**
A: All submissions must be made by February 20, 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC.

**Q: Do I need to use Uniswap SDKs?**
A: Not required, but encouraged. Projects that integrate with Uniswap protocols, SDKs, or data will be given preference.

**Q: Is there a team size limit?**
A: Teams can have up to 5 members. Solo participants are also welcome.

## Uniswap Resources

- Uniswap Documentation: https://docs.uniswap.org
- Uniswap V4 Hooks: https://docs.uniswap.org/contracts/v4/overview
- Uniswap SDK: https://docs.uniswap.org/sdk/v3/overview
- Uniswap AI Repository: https://github.com/uniswap/uniswap-ai
